TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a NORP citizen who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . At the material time , the applicant was the major shareholder in ORG ve PERSON , a NORP limited liability company which owns a DATE review entitled Haberde Yorumda Gerçek ( “ ORG and Comments ” ) , published in GPE .
CARDINAL . NORP In issue No . CARDINAL of the review , dated DATE , a news commentary entitled “ In Botan the poor peasants are expropriating the landlords ! ” was published .
The relevant parts of this news commentary read :

‘ The waves of the earthquake centred on Botan have reached all of GPE . The national liberation struggle , growing like the ripples caused by a stone cast into a pool of water , has already gone past Botan in waves , currently embracing CARDINAL districts in CARDINAL provinces in the active front of armed struggle.’

ORG [ ORG ] sources briefly describe the extent of the national struggle in GPE as follows : the said CARDINAL provinces ( together with their districts ) are PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and ORG ; while the provinces of GPE , ORG , ORG , ORG and their districts are described as being partially involved in the war .

The popular movements in the PERSON area , where CARDINAL to CARDINAL NORP live , which have developed with the rise of the national liberation movement , have made rapid strides in DATE . The political point reached in the area is that the ORG has almost become inoperative . ...
The domain vacated by the ORG in the political sense has since been occupied by the ORG in the rural areas and ORG organisations in the cities . ...
Land can not be redistributed before it is transferred to the free will of the NORP people , because it is inconceivable to distribute land that bears the seal of GPE . ...
DATE , our struggle is an external war directed against the forces of GPE . ...
We want to wage a total liberation struggle . ... ”
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( GPE PERSON ) ordered the seizure of this edition of the review on the ground that , allegedly , it disseminated propaganda against the indivisibility of the ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP In an indictment dated DATE , ORG at ORG charged the applicant , being the owner of the review , with disseminating propaganda against the indivisibility of the ORG . The charges were brought under section CARDINAL of the Prevention of Terrorism Act DATE ( -“the DATE LAW ; see paragraph CARDINAL below ) on account of the publication of the above news commentary , which concerned , inter alia , the activities of the ORG .

CARDINAL . In the proceedings before ORG , the applicant denied the charges . He pleaded that the commentary on which the charges were based in fact criticised the activities of the ORG . He invoked LAW and referred to the case - law of the Commission and the ORG . He stated that pluralism of opinions , including those opinions which shock or offend , is essential in a NORP society . He argued that the provisions of section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act restrict the right to freedom of expression in contravention of LAW and the criteria laid down by the case - law of the Commission and the ORG .

CARDINAL . In a judgment dated DATE , ORG found the applicant guilty of making propaganda against the indivisibility of the ORG . The applicant was first sentenced to a fine of MONEY ( TRL ) . Thereupon the Court , considering the good conduct of the applicant during the trial , reduced the fine to GPE CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL .

ORG , considering those parts of the news commentary cited at paragraph CARDINAL above in the light of the article as a whole , observed that it referred to certain parts of GPE as “ GPE ” . Moreover , in the words of ORG , it described the acts of the “ NORP terrorist organisation ” as a national liberation struggle , which amounted to propaganda aimed at undermining the indivisibility of the ORG .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed . He , inter alia , reiterated the defence he had relied on before ORG . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal , upholding the cogency of ORG assessment of evidence .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW DATE read as follows :
“ For the purposes of the present PERSON , the term ‘ periodicals’ shall mean newspapers , press agency dispatches and any other printed matter published at regular intervals .
‘ Publication’ shall mean the exposure , display , distribution , emission , sale or offer for sale of printed matter on LOC to which the public have access where anyone may see it .
An offence shall not be deemed to have been committed through the medium of the press unless publication has taken place , except where the material in itself is unlawful . ”
